image.altText: Machinery and cranes around a large shed with letters ASC on the iron door next to a river

props.synopsis: Traders near the shipyard where AUKUS submarines are planned to be built have mixed reactions to the US government's AUKUS review, as Premier Peter Malinauskas seeks to downplay concerns over the announcement.

title.children: 'Pretty nervous': Adelaide shipyard traders react to AUKUS review

image.altText: A red dirt road along bushland and mountains in the distance

props.synopsis: South Australian police say missing man Kyle has been found safe and well after an extensive search in the northern Flinders Ranges.

title.children: Man missing for nearly two weeks in Flinders Ranges found safe

image.altText: Two high-rise office building in a green open space

props.synopsis: A 38-storey office building with shops, restaurants and a public plaza is set to tower over South Australia's Parliament House, after the proposal was given planning approval despite concerns about heritage.

title.children: Skyscraper behind SA parliament gets green light despite heritage fears

image.altText: Taylor Walker holds a ball while walking with Matthew Nicks

props.synopsis: Adelaide coach Matthew Nicks says a "lack of accountability" remains a problem in reporting around players' futures as a story involving Taylor Walker and Nasiah Wanageen-Milera dominates headlines.

title.children: 'Unfair to all': Nicks calls out reporter's Walker racism claim

image.altText: A sign saying CORONERS COURT on a modern sandstone building

props.synopsis: A great-grandmother who died after gall bladder surgery at a regional South Australian hospital could still be alive if a surgeon had abandoned the procedure earlier or had access to a CT scan, a coroner finds.

title.children: Inquest finds death of 76yo great-grandmother could have been prevented after surgery

image.altText: A man holding papers and a notebook walks outside a court building with a woman behind him

props.synopsis: Independent MP Nick McBride says he will not walk away from state parliament, while facing court charged with three counts of assaulting his wife.

title.children: MP accused of assaulting wife to run for seat at next SA election

image.altText: A green glowing mushroom against a pitch black background

props.synopsis: Each year, eco-tourists head to South Australia's south-east to spot rare mushrooms, but drought conditions have slowed their growth along with that of other wild fungi.

title.children: Ghost mushroom season off to slow start in SA's south-east

image.altText: A singer and fellow performers on stage at the Cabaret Fringe Festival

props.synopsis: The final curtain has come down on two Adelaide festivals, who say more needs to be done to support the second level of South Australia's entertainment calendar.

title.children: Money woes force Adelaide festivals to shut

image.altText: A metal wall with Broken Hill Police Station written on it

props.synopsis: Police say they are speaking with a child as part of their investigations into the stabbing death of a 36-year-old man in outback New South Wales.

title.children: Boy, 12, assisting police following fatal stabbing in Broken Hill

image.altText: GettyImages-2218916853

props.synopsis: Erin Phillips and Daisy Pearce's contribution to football in Australia go further than the years they played in the AFLW.

title.children: Why Phillips and Pearce's contribution to footy goes far beyond the field

image.altText: a close-up of a person holding a glass under a running tap, filling it with water

props.synopsis: A parliamentary committee has heard $1.5 billion budgeted for water and waste infrastructure only covers pipelines for one of four land release sites in Adelaide, but the state government says the funding and timeline are going according to plan.

title.children: No water infrastructure funding for three land releases hoped to ease SA housing crisis

image.altText: Close-up photo of a silver and white stethoscope. Dec 2022.

props.synopsis: A GP who used his position of trust to exploit a vulnerable patient — having sex with her and failing to provide adequate care — has had his registration cancelled for four years.

title.children: 'Selfish, cruel and calculated' GP banned over relationship with patient

image.altText: A woman holding a sketch.

props.synopsis: Queer artists in South Australia's largest regional city hope having their art on public display will help other LGBTQIA+ people feel at home.

title.children: City's queer art trail helps creator 'feel safe to be myself'

image.altText: Sam Darcy is congratulated after kicking a goal.

props.synopsis: Sam Darcy plays his first match since Easter Sunday, as the Western Bulldogs attempt to get their season back on track against St Kilda at Docklands. Follow live.

title.children: Darcy on target against Saints as Bulldogs survive injury scare

image.altText: A sketch of Erin Patterson wearing a blue jumper and thin framed black glasses with her hair tied back.

props.synopsis: The cook of the deadly beef Wellington lunch rejects a prosecution claim she carried out factory resets in a bid to deceive police about her mobile phones, as she finishes giving evidence in her triple-murder trial.

title.children: Erin Patterson denies using mobile phone factory resets to deceive police

image.altText: The side of a South Australian police car parked in a street.

props.synopsis: South Australian police have found three children who were reported missing safe and well.

title.children: Three SA children reported missing found safe and well

image.altText: A woman smiles while she holds up some fabric.

props.synopsis: Regional fashion designers who source their fabrics from op shops, dead stock, and even off the sheep's back say they offer a more sustainable alternative to fast fashion.

title.children: Small designers struggle to compete in flooded fast-fashion market

image.altText: An LA shopping mall burns in a huge orange fire as a shirtless man on a motorbike and an amblance park down the road.

props.synopsis: In 1992 the National Guard was called into Los Angeles to help control widespread, destructive rioting. But right now those forces appear to be escalating the situation and some experts are warning it is all in the name of "political theatre".

title.children: 'It's a very different scale': The difference between Los Angeles now and in 1992

image.altText: An emu standing outside the front door of a home.

props.synopsis: Residents are urged not to leave food and water out for the migrating wildlife despite worsening drought conditions.

title.children: Wildlife moves to built-up areas in search of food, water in drought

image.altText: An elderly woman and man, who is in a wheelchair, in their living room.

props.synopsis: Clients of aged and disability care service Annecto say they have not been told who will be taking its place.

title.children: Sudden closure of major care provider leaves thousands scrambling

image.altText: Samples of rare earth minerals in vials

props.synopsis: A Melbourne small business finds itself unwittingly on the frontline of the trade stand-off between Donald Trump and Xi Jinping, as rare earths present an opportunity for Australia.

title.children: Why rare earths are ‘not merely essential’ but of ‘existential importance’

image.altText: A white-haired, middle-aged man in a dark suit holds a hat as he crosses a city street.

props.synopsis: A man who has accused Gareth Ward of sexually assaulting him told a parliamentary staffer years after the alleged rape that the politician had "done something" to him, a court has heard.

title.children: Court hears of 'emotional' conversation with MP's alleged rape victim

image.altText: A man wearing a navy tuxedo and bow tie turns his outstretched palms upwards

props.synopsis: Khaby Lame, the world's most-followed TikTok personality, has voluntarily departed the US after he was detained by immigration officers in Las Vegas.

title.children: Popular TikTok personality leaves US as pro-Trump influencer boasts of reporting him

image.altText: Anthony Albanese Press Club speech

props.synopsis: A potential in-person meeting between Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and US President Donald Trump is still anticipated, but senior sources told the ABC it was too soon to be "definitive" and there were "lots of moving parts".

title.children: Albanese-Trump meeting in limbo as Israel sanctions trigger US rebuke

image.altText: Brittany looks into the camera, as other cameras are pointed at her while she walks along.

props.synopsis: The National Anti-Corruption Commission has investigated corruption claims made regarding a settlement paid by the Commonwealth to former Liberal staffer Brittany Higgins.

title.children: Corruption watchdog clears Brittany Higgins's $2.4 million payout

image.altText: A man in a pink shirt smiling

props.synopsis: The man whose genius for melody, arrangements and wide-eyed self-expression inspired summertime anthems was as pitied for his demons as he was celebrated for his gifts.

title.children: The Beach Boys' Brian Wilson was a visionary leader and troubled genius

image.altText: Liberal party MP Moira Deeming exits from a joint party meeting, wearing a blue dress.

props.synopsis: Victoria's Independent Broad-based Anti-Corruption Commission has been asked to investigate Moira Deeming's offer to delay bankruptcy proceedings against John Pesutto.

title.children: Moira Deeming referred to corruption investigators over John Pesutto offer

image.altText: A punter playing the poker machines in a Sydney club

props.synopsis: A leading charity describes the system governing poker machines as "broken" following a damning auditor-general's report.

title.children: In parts of Sydney 'entire salaries are disappearing into poker machines'

image.altText: couch in living room with coffee table and window

props.synopsis: From rugs covering water damage, to artificial lighting making spaces look brighter, stylists use all kinds of tricks when staging a home for sale.

title.children: Buyers' agents give us their tips on what to know when inspecting staged properties

image.altText: Cate Campbell

props.synopsis: Cate Campbell believes Australia's swimmers would be in a better mental state if they were paid better and could afford time off as a result.

title.children: Campbell says lack of pay behind swimmers' mental health struggles

image.altText: An aerial view of coastline.

props.synopsis: While existing properties can remain, the City of Busselton's decision bans all future unhosted short-stay accommodation from residential areas of the popular coastal WA region.

title.children: New Busselton Airbnb crackdown aims to get locals into houses

image.altText: Close-up of a young woman applying sunscreen on her tanned shoulder to protect her skin from the sun.

props.synopsis: Sunscreen testing by Choice finds many popular brands do not meet their SPF claims, but experts say sunscreens remain safe and effective.

title.children: Only four of 20 popular sunscreens pass Choice's SPF testing

image.altText: Ali Elmoubayed in tracksuit outside court

props.synopsis: Three people are arrested after bullets were fired into the house of an alleged Sydney crime figure shortly after he left for a scheduled court appearance.

title.children: 'Are Raptor there?': Alleged Sydney crime figure reacts to house shooting

image.altText: Post-it notes, one with a hand, house and dollar sign, among other papers.

props.synopsis: Some universities in Canada are offering "Adulting 101" classes to teach students basic life skills like doing your taxes or changing a tyre. Should Australian schools be doing more?

title.children: Are teens taught enough life skills to know how to 'adult'?
